bill_title: to provide for legislative review of zoning ordinances if there is a protest filed.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for legislative review of zoning ordinances if there is a protest filed. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 11-4-5 be amended to read as follows: 11-4-5. If such an ordinance be is adopted, the same ordinance shall be published and take effect as other ordinances unless the referendum be is invoked, or unless a written protest be is filed with the auditor or clerk, signed by at least forty fifty-five percent of the owners of equity in the lots included in any proposed district and the lands within one hundred fifty feet from any part of such proposed district measured by excluding streets and alleys. A corporation shall be construed to be a sole owner, and when if parcels of land are in the name of more than one person, ownership representation shall be in proportion to the number of signers who join in the petition in relation to the number of owners. In the event such If a protest be is filed, the ordinance shall not become effective as to the proposed district against which the protest has been filed. Such written protest shall not be allowed as governing body of the municipality shall review the protest and make a determination. The provisions of this section do not apply to any ordinance regulating or establishing flood plain areas. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for legislative review of zoning ordinances if there is a protest filed. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 11-4-5 be amended to read as follows: 11-4-5. If such an ordinance be is adopted, the same ordinance shall be published and take effect as other ordinances unless the referendum be is invoked, or unless a written protest be is filed with the auditor or clerk, signed by at least forty fifty-five percent of the owners of equity in the lots included in any proposed district and the lands within one two hundred fifty feet from any part of such proposed district measured by excluding streets and alleys . A corporation shall be construed to be a sole owner, and when if parcels of land are in the name of more than one person, ownership representation shall be in proportion to the number of signers who join in the petition in relation to the number of owners. In the event such If a protest be is filed, the ordinance shall does not become effective as to the proposed district against which the protest has been filed. Such written protest shall not be allowed as unless the ordinance is approved by two-thirds of the governing body of the municipality. The provisions of this section do not apply to any ordinance regulating or establishing flood plain areas. BILL HISTORY 1/21/98 First read in House and referred to Local Government. H.J. 152 2/3/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/3/98 Local Government Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 11, NAYS 2. H.J. 375

H.J. 432 2/9/98 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 50, NAYS 7. H.J. 458

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for legislative review of zoning ordinances if there is a protest filed. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 11-4-5 be amended to read as follows: 11-4-5. If such an ordinance be is adopted, the same ordinance shall be published and take effect as other ordinances unless the referendum be is invoked, or unless a written protest be is filed with the auditor or clerk, signed by at least forty percent of the owners of equity in the lots included in any proposed district and the lands within one two hundred fifty feet from any part of such proposed district measured by excluding streets and alleys . A corporation shall be construed to be a sole owner, and when if parcels of land are in the name of more than one person, ownership representation shall be in proportion to the number of signers who join in the petition in relation to the number of owners. In the event such If a protest be is filed, the ordinance shall does not become effective as to the proposed district against which the protest has been filed. Such written protest shall not be allowed as unless the ordinance is approved by two-thirds of the governing body of the municipality. The protest provisions of this section do not apply to any ordinance regulating or establishing flood plain areas. BILL HISTORY 1/21/98 First read in House and referred to Local Government. H.J. 152 2/3/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/3/98 Local Government Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 11, NAYS 2. H.J. 375 2/6/98 House of Representatives Deferred to another day.
